object-inclusion

See also

object_creation | object_declaration

Definition

An object-inclusion is a statement* that an object declared in a universe-of-discourse is a constitutive element of a theory-elaboration-sequence.

*. Here, statement is considered in its general meaning, distinct from theory_statement.

In straightforward language, an object-inclusion extends a theory-elaboration-sequence with an object, which makes it possible to infer statements about that object.
